titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3546) to provide for a national dialogue on Social Security and to establish the Bipartisan Panel to Design Long-Range Social Security Reform.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-498, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3546 with 3 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Providing for the consideration of the bill in the House. Measure will be read by section. A specified amendment is in order. It shall be in order to consider an amendment printed in the Congressional Record, if offered by Rep Rangel. The amendment recommended by the Committee on Ways and Means now printed in the bill, as modified by the amendments printed in the report accompanying this resolution, shall be considered as adopted. amendment is in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 170.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 4/28/1998--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (modified closed) for the consideration of H.R. 3546 (social security revisions).
